label: Description
value: Woven picture of a seated Betsy Ross sewing the first American flag was made for the Louisiana Purchase Exposition or as it was commonly known, the St. Louis World’s Fair of 1904. Betsy Ross sits with the flag on the front porch of a clapboard house with a spinning wheel and cat. Scene was originally flanked by the 1905 calendar: first half of the year on the left and the second half on the right. Both have been cut away.

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 1970.12

label: Notes
value: Woven picture of a seated Betsy Ross sewing the first American flag was made for the Louisiana Purchase Exposition or as it was commonly known, the St. Louis World’s Fair of 1904. Betsy Ross sits with the flag on the front porch of a clapboard house with a spinning wheel and cat. Scene was originally flanked by the 1905 calendar: first half of the year on the left and the second half on the right. Both have been cut away.

label: Description
value: Printed patchwork fragment has the image of President James A. Garfield and alternating shield flags patterned with either stars and stripes or an anchor with stars. Remaining quadrants have a printed patchwork design and are divided into eight equal triangles filled with four different patterns. This particular image of Garfield in profile wearing a white shirt and dark jacket and tie is based on a photograph from the Pach Brothers photography studio of New York and was widely circulated around the United States.

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 1992.88.136

label: Credit line
value: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Katharine Kreiser and Arthur Larson

label: Notes

label: Description
value: Commemorative fragment has small offset medallions in a scalloped oval frame containing the portrait of George Washington. Printed on a natural-colored ground, these scalloped medallions have very fine dark branches that radiate outward from each frame.

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 2014.139.1

label: Credit line
value: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Rochester Historical Society

label: Notes
value: Commemorative fragment has small offset medallions in a scalloped oval frame containing the portrait of George Washington. Printed on a natural-colored ground, these scalloped medallions have very fine dark branches that radiate outward from each frame.

label: Description
value: Woven textile serves as a commemorative of the US centennial while promoting the textile manufacturer Pacific Mills of Lawrence, Massachusetts. Woven in black and cream, the composition has a bold graphic quality and depicts a broadly soaring eagle over a large modern factory enclosed in curvilinear frame. In between each factory is a plaque identifying the Treasurer, Agent and Selling Agent of the business.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, wool Technique: jacquard woven

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 1969.19

label: Credit line
value: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of George Gelineau

label: Notes
value: Woven textile serves as a commemorative of the US centennial while promoting the textile manufacturer Pacific Mills of Lawrence, Massachusetts. Woven in black and cream, the composition has a bold graphic quality and depicts a broadly soaring eagle over a large modern factory enclosed in curvilinear frame. In between each factory is a plaque identifying the Treasurer, Agent and Selling Agent of the business.

label: Description
value: Commemorative textile with a depiction of the short-lived Dewey Arch and colonnade. Arch and colonnade are in white on a dark green ground. Diamond-shaped patchwork pattern in red, yellow, pink, and dark ground surround central arch motif. This textile was part of Hamilton's Zaza Quilting Line.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed Label: printed cotton

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 2007.141

label: Notes
value: Commemorative textile with a depiction of the short-lived Dewey Arch and colonnade. Arch and colonnade are in white on a dark green ground. Diamond-shaped patchwork pattern in red, yellow, pink, and dark ground surround central arch motif. This textile was part of Hamilton's Zaza Quilting Line.

label: Description
value: Commemorative textile with red, white and blue vertical stripes with scattered stars enclosing abbreviationss of state names. A medallion of Columbus discovering America alternates with the Status of Liberty. On the left side, small medallions of Washington alternate with a map of the Americas. On the right side, medallions of the Capitol Building alternate with a portrait of Columbus.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 1992.88.215

label: Credit line
value: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Katharine Kreiser and Arthur Larson

label: Notes
value: Commemorative textile with red, white and blue vertical stripes with scattered stars enclosing abbreviations of state names. A large medallion of Columbus discovering America alternates with the Status of Liberty. On the left side, small medallions of President George Washington alternate with a map of the Americas. On the right side, medallions of the Capitol Building alternate with a portrait of Columbus.

label: Description
value: Linen sewing bag embroidered in the Arts and Crafts style. Bag has a front flap which creates an interior pocket. One inch below the top a green silk ribbon is threaded through a casing stitched with green thread. Embroidered in blue, green and dark rose in geometric shapes outlined in black.

value: Medium: linen foundation, silk embroidery and drawstring Technique: embroidered on plain weave

value: 2016, given to Cooper Hewitt. Formerly collection of American Textile History Museum, 1997.8.2

Catalogue for the Karasz Exhibition, Hanfstaengl Galleries, New York, NY

label: Description
value: Tri-fold booklet with printed black text throughout. One large reproduction of a linoleum cut print featuring a female nude standing underneath a curving leafy tree, her arms bent upwards, a robe draped over her right arm. Printed details contain the dates and title of the exhibition and titles of the included prints.

label: Provenance
value: Marilyn Friedman, New York, NY; 2016 acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: Tri-fold booklet with printed black text throughout. One large reproduction of a linoleum cut print featuring a female nude standing underneath a curving leafy tree, her arms bent upwards, a robe draped over her right arm. label: Description
value: Folding fan with Aesthetic Movement style printed cotton leaf depicting eight different overlapping designs for ceramic plates of the period surrounded by a small fish scale pattern. The reverse leaf is dyed and glazed dark brown cottton. The sticks and guards are made of wood ebonized black with unpainted wood slips in between the two layers of the leaf. At the edge of the fan, binding the two layers together, is a narrow woven binding tape that is dyed black. At the rivet there is a bone washer and metal loop.

label: Physical description
value: Printed cotton leaf on obverse with dyed and glazed cotton leaf on reverse; narrow woven binding at edge of leaf; ebonized wood sticks with wood slips; metal loop and bone washer at the rivet.

label: Provenance
value: 2016, gift of Heather Sandifer to CHSDM; 1995, Heather Sandifer was given the fans by her mother, Lorraine Elsie Mason.  Mrs. Mason was a colector of decorative arts and aquired a group of fans at auction in the late 1950's-60's from an auction house in Armonk, NY, John C. Stromak.

label: Notes
value: Folding fan with Aesthetic Movement style printed cotton leaf depicting eight different overlapping designs for ceramic plates of the period surrounded by a small fish scale pattern. At the edge of the fan, binding the two layers together, is a narrow woven binding tape that is dyed black. At the rivet there is a bone washer and metal loop.

label: Physical description
value: Front leaf of very fine plain woven dyed and painted silk adhered to paper; back leaf of paper with areas of silver leaf; stained bamboo sticks; exotic wood guards (possibly palm wood). Glass or plastic button at the rivet.

label: Provenance
value: 2016, gift of Heather Sandifer to CHSDM; 1995, Heather Sandifer was given the fans by her mother, Lorraine Elsie Mason in 1995.  Mrs. Mason was a colector of decorative arts and aquired a group of fans at auction in the late 1950's-60's from an auction house in Armonk, NY, John C. Stromak.

label: Description
value: Approximately thirty different patterns all available as matched sets of sidewall, border, and ceiling paper. Each pattern is shown in multiple colorways. Predominant colors in this catalogue are red and green, with more limited blue and beige/tan. Patterns include florals, medallions, stripes, and some all-over designs.

label: Provenance
value: Given to museum by Stephen H. Van Dyk, 2011.

label: Notes
value: Approximately thirty different patterns all available as matched sets of sidewall, border, and ceiling paper. Each pattern is shown in multiple colorways. Predominant colors in this catalogue are red and green, with more limited blue and beige/tan. Patterns include florals, medallions, stripes, and some all-over designs.

label: Description
value: Font (a) with cover (b) of gothic arches formed from radiating cyma curves which result in a peaked dome shape. Segments of the dome are adorned with foliate patterns. The font is further decorated with tresfoils around the body of the basin and quatrefoils at the lip of both the basin and the lid. The font rises on a stepped plinth and an octagonal base.

label: Provenance
value: Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw; 2018: acquired by Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw

label: Notes
value: Font (a) with cover (b) of gothic arches formed from radiating cyma curves which result in a peaked dome shape. Segments of the dome are adorned with foliate patterns. The font is further decorated with tresfoils around the body of the basin and quatrefoils at the lip of both the basin and the lid. The font rises on a stepped plinth and an octagonal base.

label: Description
value: Model of a roof frame as a conglomeration of frame types: front as a flat, slanted "shed" roof; right side, a roof with a convex curve to create a dome; left side with angled "gambrel" roof line; back left open as if to be mounted on a building. Inside elements arranged as beams and joints of the supporting structure.

label: Provenance
value: 2018: acquired by Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum from the Eugene Thaw collection.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw

label: Notes
value: Model of a roof frame as a conglomeration of frame types: front as a flat, slanted "shed" roof; right side, a roof with a convex curve to create a dome; left side with angled "gambrel" roof line; back left open as if to be mounted on a building. Inside elements arranged as beams and joints of the supporting structure.
